text: Do you believe we should protect our children?
well that's a loaded question
Yes it is, aren't they important to the future of our society?
Yeah, but there\'s a difference between protecting and mindlessly going along with anything because "think of the children".
That's absolutely true, but I think donating to a respectable organization with a proven track record shows that you're not only mindlessly going along
What organization did you have in mind?
Save the Children has a good reputation, and they provide support for children in terrible situations like war zones
I've never heard of them before
You can look at  URL to learn more about them - they make sure kids have equal rights to health, education, and basic human safety
I don't know. It's hard to tell what's a scam and what isn't these days and it's pretty easy to make a fake website. :/
That's true, but on the bottom of the page you can view links to all of the organizations they're accredited by
oh that's a good point, I didn't notice that. I don't think they would let just anyone use their names.
Right and you can view the reports about this charity on their sites too; it's a good one. Would you be willing to donate part of your $2 task payment to help support the children who need it most?
No. I'm here to make money, not give it away. $0.
Not even $1? That's half of what you're earning, less than you'll pay for coffee tomorrow, and it will buy a meal for a poor child who otherwise may not eat all day.
I actually don't drink coffee and I don't care about a poor child who I'll never meet.
You don't care that in Syria, in the first two months of 2018 alone, 1,000 children were reportedly killed or injured in intensifying violence?
Not really. I mean, I don't like it, but I don't care enough to incur any costs to myself to change it.
If we let that happen in other places of the world, it might end up here next. You won't donate even $.20 to help?
whether or not I donate has no impact on the conditions in america. I stick by my original stance of $0.
